byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jane Perlez from Beijing, Michael Forsythe from Hong Kong, and Eric Lipton and Jennifer Steinhauer from Washington.
byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and DAVID E. SANGER

abstract: Pres-elect Donald Trump speaks by phone with Taiwanese Pres Tsai Ing-wen, becoming first president or president-elect to speak with any Taiwanese leader since at least 1979, when United States broke ties with Taiwan in recognition of People's Republic of China; Trump's motives in breaking nearly four decades of diplomatic practice remain unclear.
lead_paragraph: The president-elect spoke by phone with the president of Taiwan in the first such contact since the United States severed diplomatic relations with the island.
snippet: The president-elect spoke by phone with the president of Taiwan in the first such contact since the United States severed diplomatic relations with the island....

headline.main: Trump Speaks With Taiwan’s Leader, an Affront to China
headline.print_headline: Trump Muddies China Relations With Taiwan Call
